summary.title: Barlaams saga ok Jósafats
summary.note: AM 231 I-X fol. consists of fragments of Barlaams saga ok Jósafats, the story of an Indian prince who was converted to Christianity by the hermit Barlaam.

binding.p: Bound in a BD-binding with cloth spine and corners from 1969; 314 245 45 .

custEvent.p: During restoration the fragments were put on meeting guards and bound in a BD-binding.

list.item: Black and white prints from June 1967.

msItem.incipit: ſakada meðr athygli þeira vis dom ok tru.
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 121:1-35 Ed. l
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 111:16-29, 112:9-22 Ed. d
Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 141:19-144:2 Ed. p1
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 132:20-134:29 Ed. d

msItem.incipit: Riddarar woro þar till vpp ſtigande
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 153:20-155:33 Ed. p2
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 142:36-145:11 Ed. d

foliation.p: The leaves are paginated by a later hand at the top, between the columns.

condition.p: Several of the leaves are damaged as they previously were used as covers for books. The bottom part of fol. 10 is missing. Some of the leaves are so blackened and worn that reading them is difficult.

layout.p: The fragments are written in double columns with 35 lines per column. Rubrics in red. Flourished initials in various colours.

handNote.p: Written by a single scribe; the script is Icelandic Gothic bookhand.

additions.p:
The title (Barlaams saga) appear on the top rectos of fols 1-10 + 12s and at the bottom of fol. 11r. Scribbles occur in the margins throughout the manuscript.
Fol. 7r, bottom margin: Stephan olafsson.
Fol. 7r, right margin: Stephan Olafsson.
Fol. 8v, bottom margen: Þetta blad vonaſt komid
fr Muncka Þver.
Fol. 11r, top margin: fra Sera Hannesa i Reykhollte.
Fol. 11r, Bottom margin: þad er godur penne.

accMat.p:
There are three AM-slips:
The first, concerning fols 1-5 reads: Ur Barlaams Sỏgu
5. blỏd.
komin fra Sr Olafi Gud
mundzsyne.
The second, concerning fols 6-7 reads: Ur Barlaams Sỏgu.
fra Sr Snorra Jonssyne 1721.
The third, concerning fols 8-9 reads: fra Sr Þorvalldi
Stephanssyne.
1704.
Einn madr tti hundrat
sauda.

provenance.p:
According to the AM-slips the following leaves belonged to the following people:
Fols 1-5 to the priest Ólafur Guðmundsson,
Fols 6-7 to the priest Snorri Jónsson.
In the seventeenth century fols 8-9 belonged to Munkaþverá and later a priest called Þorvaldur Stefánsson.
Fols 11-12 belonged to the priest Hannes Halldórsson of Reykholt. . In the margin of fol. 7r a hand from the seventeenth century wrote: Stephan Olafsson (twice) and in the bottom margin of fol 8v the following is written: Þetta blad vonaſt komid
fr Muncka Þver.

acquisition.p:
According to the AM-slips and the marginal notes on fols 8r and 11v Árni Magnússon acquired
fols 1-5 from Ólafur Guðmundsson,
fols 6-7 from Snorri Jónsson in 1721,
fols 8-9 from Þorvaldur Stefánsson in 1704
and fols 11-12 from Hannes Halldórsson of Reykholt .

msItem.title: Barlaams saga ok Jósafats
msItem.explicit: En þo vrðv þeira likamir ſiðan
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 31:33-34:20 Ed. b
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 22:31-25:31 Ed. e1

condition.p: The upper part of the outer column has been torn off.

layout.p: Written in double columns with 35 lines per column. Traces of red initials (majuscules). The initial G is rubricated in red ink. The rubrics are faded.

handNote.p: Fragment II is written in an Icelandic Gothic bookhand. The hand is identical to the one of fragment IX and these two fragments possibly originally belonged to the same manuscript.

additions.p: Fol. 1r hos additions referring to the manuscript itself: II (AM 231. fol.) and Barlaams saga. 230. fol. 19-20b. written in the bottom margin.

origin.p:
Written in Iceland. Kristian Kålund (
) dated it to the fourteenth century. Magnus Rindal ( Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 1981 31 ) har dog dateret det mere præcist til fourteenth centurys første halvdel.

msItem.explicit: þa i oðru ſinni þann rika domara
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 45:33-49:1 Ed. c1
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 37:18-41:3 Ed. f1
Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 67:3-70:5 Ed. c2
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 58:3-61:17 Ed. f1

msItem.incipit: Kon vngſ son svarar. Ger ſua vel
msItem.explicit: Ef ek viſſi at goð vri
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 94:28-97:27 Ed. c3
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 84:10-87:18 Ed. f1

msItem.explicit: Nv lagða ek hug a at hafa þik með mer. firi tveim
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 142:17-30, 143:10-24, 144:1-14, 144:18-145:3 Ed. o
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 133:15-29, 134:2-17, 217:3-19, 218:7-21 Ed. f1

condition.p: Only the top 18 lines of fol. 4 are extant and the text is only partly legible due to holes in the parchment.

layout.p: Written in double columns with 35 lines to each column (18 on fol. 4). Red initials (majuscules) and rubrics.

handNote.p: Fragment III is written by a single scribe who also wrote the fragment Holm Perg 13 VI fol.. The hand is an Icelandic Gothic bookhand. The two fragments presumably were part of the same codex.

additions.p: The title (Barlaams saga) and references to leaves are written in the bottom margins of fols 1r and 2r and in the top margins of fols 3r and 4r. Occasional scribbles and single words.

msItem.title: Barlaams saga ok Jósafats
msItem.incipit: Barlám ſuarar þat kalla ek ſialf ræde
msItem.explicit:
er oſſ megi gagn af ſtan
da
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 71:3-73:33 Ed. f
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 62:21-65:6 Ed. j

foliation.p: Fol. 1r is foliated by a later hand.

layout.p: Written in double columns with 34 lines to each column. The scribe has let blank spaces for initials and rubrics.

additions.p: The title (Barlaams saga) is written in the bottom margin of the leaf. Only a few words are written in the other margins.

origin.p: Written in Iceland in the fifteenth century.

msItem.incipit: Herra konungr ver erum æigi ſkylder
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 108:16-111:35 Ed. h
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 97:28-101:31 Ed. g1
Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 126:9-129:32 Ed. m
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 116:23-120:14 Ed. g1

msItem.incipit: oc til fyſt til þeira fagnaða
msItem.explicit: þviat ſteínguð yðart ſkal verða at dusti
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 162:24-16:11 Ed. r
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 152:11-156:22 Ed. g1

foliation.p: Fols 1 to 3 are foliated by a later hand in the upper right-hand corners.

condition.p:
All of the leaves are damaged:
Fol. 1 has holes in the top margin and along the inner margin.
Fol. 2 has holes too; the top margin is cut off and the middle part of the inner column is torn off.
There is a large amount of holes on fol. 3 too and the top margin and the inner column are cut away.

layout.p: The fragment is written in two columns with 42 lines per column. Rubrics in red.

handNote.p:
Fragment V is written in an Icelandic Gothic bookhand. This fragment and Holm Perg 12 V fol. seem to be written by the same scribe and it is very likely that the two fragments are two parts of the same codex. Keyser and Unger (
xxi ) describe the hand as old and beautiful.

additions.p: A later hand added the title (Barlaams saga) in the bottom margins of the recto pages.

accMat.p:
There is an AM-slip reading: Ur Barlaams Sỏgu
fra Sr Snorra Jonssyne
1721.

acquisition.p: According to fragment V's AM-slip Árni Magnússon acquired fol. 2 from his nephew, the priest Snorri Jónsson of Helgafell, in 1721.

msItem.incipit: ſyndi ſik imikilli ʀeiði uið ſun ſiɴ
msItem.explicit: til ſinnar dyrdar uara nattuʀo ok

Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 100:24-103:9 Ed. h1

msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 137:12-139:29 Ed. n
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 128:3-130:29 Ed. h1

foliation.p: Foliated by a later hand in the upper right-hand corners of the recto pages.

condition.p: Both leaves are damaged and holed.

layout.p: Written in double columns with 37 lines per column. Spor af initialer (majuskler) i forskellige farver; spor af røde rubrikker.

additions.p:
There are a few additions:
Top margin of fol. 1r: I Naffne fauður og sonar Og H Anda
Heylagx.
In the bottom margins of the recto pages the title (Barlaams saga) is written.
In the bottom margin of fol. 2v,Árni Magnússon skrevet Fra Skeliavík i Steingrimsfirde.

acquisition.p: According to a note on fol. 2v by Árni Magnússon he acquired the fragment from Skeljavík in Steingrímsfjörður.

msItem.explicit: ek þottumz eigi mer einn ærinn
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 117:35-120:31 Ed. k1
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 108:1-111:12 Ed. i

msItem.explicit: en konungs sun hefi ek eigi
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 126:28-129:29 Ed. k2
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 117:8-120:10 Ed. i

foliation.p: Folieret on the top of the recto pages by a later hand.

condition.p: The bottom part of both leaves is cut off.

layout.p: Written in one column with 36 lines per page. The scribe has left blank spaces for initials and rubrics.

additions.p: The title (Barlaams saga) is indsat af en senere hånd i bl. 1r og 2r's øverste margen.

accMat.p:
There is an AM-slip: Fra Capitain Magnuſe Araſyne
1727. og hafdi hann þeſſe blỏd
feinged ur Iſafiardar Syſlu.
Eru ur Sỏgu Barlaams.

provenance.p: Ifølge oplysningen på AM-sedlen har de to blade tilhørt kaptajn Magnús Arason, som i sin tid fik dem fra Ísafjarðarsýsla.

acquisition.p: Árni Magnússon acquired the fragmant from Magnús Arason in 1727.

msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 149:12-152:32 Ed. q1
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 138:19-142:14 Ed. k

Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 155:24-160:6 Ed. k

foliation.p: Foliated between the columns by a later hand.

condition.p: The outer half of fol. 1 is cut off.

layout.p: Written in one column with 44 lines per page. There are blank spaces for initials.

additions.p: A later hand wrote the title (Barlaams saga) in the bottom margin of the recto pages.

origin.p: Written in Iceland in the fifteenth century.

msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 167:11-170:3 Ed. s1
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 157:28-160:31 Ed. e2
Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 181:19-184:8 Ed. s2
Rindal, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 168:31-172:2 Ed. e2

foliation.p: Foliated between the columns by a later hand.

condition.p: The bottom part of both leaves is cut off.

layout.p: Written in double columns with 33 extant lines per column.

handNote.p: Fragment IX is written in the same Icelandic Gothic bookhand as fragment II. Presumably they both belonged to the same manuscript.

decoNote.p: Traces of red initials and rubrics.

additions.p: The title (Barlaams saga) is added in a later hand in the recto sides, in top margin and in the inner margin, respectively.

msItem.title: Barlaams saga ok Jósafats
msItem.explicit: ihesus christus med mier. er. bæde fre lſade
msItem.bibl: Keyser and Unger, Barlaams ok Josaphats saga 186:7-188:27 Ed. t

foliation.p: The leaf is foliated by a later hand.

layout.p: Written in one column with 36 lines per page. Blank spaces are left for later insertion of initials and rubrics.

additions.p: The title (Barlaams saga) is written on the bottom margin of the recto.

accMat.p: A Letter from the priest Franz Íbsson of Hrúni in Árnessýsla to an Erlendur Ólafsson (dated 30. august 1728) is attached and kept as accompanying materialfor AM 231 X fol.

origin.p: Written in Iceland in the fifteenth century.

acquisition.p: According to the letter from Franz Ibsson he sent this leaf to Árni Magnússon in Copenhagen in 1728.
